column5: I try to prepare for the weather up there prior to leaving on the trip, but I have one problem. I look at three different online weahter forecasts and they are all different. Just wondering if anyone trusts a specific service and if so, what is the address? Thanks.
I use accuweather.com seems to be pretty reliable

wunderground.comI use accuweather.com for long range forecasts. I put their widget on a blog I created for our yearly trip. thechutes09.blogspot.com. Just a bunch of B.S. We are all so geographically separated now we have to use the internet to smack talk.
We use The Weather Network while in Canada...http://www.theweathernetwork.com/weather/CAON0578 It also has radar and a bug report.
Thanks Moondog. This is a good site.

This is the url of the site that I use. http://www.weatheroffice.gc.ca/forec...l?on-91&unit=iit has satlite and radar to allow you to zoom in to your spot so you can see how far the storm is away and how quick it is moving. Youngcanadianguide
I use accuweather it seems to be right for the most part.
I do print-outs from Environment Canada, The Weather Network and AccuWeather before I leave and get totally different weather when I arrive.
